intro: Fagraea curtisii var. calcarea, commonly known as the limestone fagraea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions with limestone soils. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and produces clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it is not widely cultivated outside its native range.
